meanings.definition: A person or thing that rumbles.
meanings.sent1: The rumblers in the distance turned out to be a group of motorcycles.
meanings.sent2: The city was filled with the sound of rumblers coming from the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The rumblers in the old house were just the noisy pipes.
meanings.sent4: The rumblers of the thunderstorm shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The rumblers of the approaching train could be felt through the ground.

meanings.definition: A group of people who rumble.
meanings.sent1: The rumblers gathered in the alley for a fight.
meanings.sent2: The rumblers clashed in the street, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent3: The rumblers at the party were just playfully arguing over the music choice.
meanings.sent4: The rumblers of the debate club always had lively discussions.
meanings.sent5: The rumblers of the dance group moved in perfect sync.

meanings.definition: A sound or noise that rumbles.
meanings.sent1: The rumblers of the approaching storm could be heard in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The rumblers of the train echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The rumblers of the old fridge made it seem like it was alive.
meanings.sent4: The rumblers of the earthquake shook the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The rumblers of the avalanche could be felt before it was seen.
